body:
This Idea Came From The Mineplex Server.

So what I mean by personnel player hosting is.

Anyone with Emerald Rank + can host there own server for anyone from the community to join and play games with them.

This is not like Scrum servers, this is where you can 24/7 play the games you want to play, since you can't have a scrum server all the time. Idk tell me what you think.

replies.body:
No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No. No.
Compare Mineplex with Avicus
Compare 18000 people with 100 people
Compare 1TB RAM with 1TB HDD space
Compare your brain with the brain of a mouse.


Avicus' has not enough good server hardware to afford such expectations.
replies.body_tagged:

Avicus' has not enough good server hardware to afford such expectations.

replies.body: If you're prepared to invest the money into hosting however many servers per player.
replies.body_tagged: If you're prepared to invest the money into hosting however many servers per player.

replies.body:
That would cause a lot of lag :/

On the other hand, this idea inspired me to make a prize suggestion for the next tournament.

Maybe a 24/7 scrimmage server for the team that wins the next tournament would be cool. They would give the server to the next winner of the next tournament.

replies.body:
Hmm. +0.5 because I like the idea, it would be nice to get such a prize.

Otherwise, the already "best" team of Avicus would be able to practise 24/7 and will make them more OP. I think if they already won, they don't need it. :D

EDIT: Now it's +0.8 :) (see replies)

replies.body:
Having more servers wouldn't necessarily lag anything at all. They are different servers. 

We could maybe add it to the shop, reserving our rights to revoke it when needed. It's not a bad idea, but it would cost quite a lot for a normal user to afford it I guess. We definitely have more important things to worry about at the moment... again not a bad idea at all, just not very doable right now :)

We definitely have more important things to worry about at the moment... again not a bad idea at all, just not very doable right now :)
